definitions.example: Suzanne collected all the papers she had laid out.

definitions.definition: To get; particularly, get from someone.
definitions.example: A bank collects a monthly payment on a client's new car loan.   A mortgage company collects a monthly payment on a house.

definitions.definition: To accumulate (a number of similar or related objects), particularly for a hobby or recreation.
definitions.example: I don't think he collects as much as hoards.

definitions.definition: To form a conclusion; to deduce, infer. (Compare gather, get.)
(often with on or against) To collect payments.
definitions.example: He had a lot of trouble collecting on that bet he made.

definitions.definition: To come together in a group or mass.
(of a vehicle or driver) To collide with or crash into (another vehicle or obstacle).
definitions.example: The truck veered across the central reservation and collected a car that was travelling in the opposite direction.
the collected works of Charles Dickens
He stayed collected throughout the ordeal.
